item.title: Academic Stuff
item.description: Here are all academic concepts I find interesting! Stochastic Gradient Descent Back Propagation

item.title: Assessing Demographic Bias in Named Entity Recognition
item.description: This paper can be found here Summary This paper, composed by a group of researchers at twitter, assesses how differences in demographic backgrounds present in text can affect various natural language processing (NLP) models’ performance in the task of Named Entity Recognition.

item.title: Backpropagation
item.description: Before reading this, make sure to read the piece on Gradient Descent, as this will build off of that piece.

item.title: Coin Change II
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given an array of coin denominations coins and an integer amount, return the number of combinations of coins you can make that add up to amount.

item.title: Container with the Most Water
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem There is a robot that is in an m x n grid. It is positioned in the top left corner (0,0).

item.title: Container with the Most Water
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem You are given an integer array of length n, height. There are n vertical line segments drawn such that the endpoints of these line segments are (i, 0) and (i, height[i]).

item.title: Decode Ways
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem A message containing letters from A-Z can be encoded in the following mapping:

item.title: Funk Wav Bounces Vol. 1 by Calvin Harris
item.description: Calvin Harris managed to capture summer in a bottle with this album. Every song on this album perfectly exudes the summer vibe.

item.title: Grid Game
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem There is a 0-indexed 2-D array grid of dimensions 2 x n where the value at grid[r][c] is the point value at position (r,c).

item.title: House Robber
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem You are a robber that is planning to rob houses along a street.

item.title: Jump Game II
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given the root of a binary tree, return the diameter of the tree.

item.title: Jump Game II
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem The problem is as follows: given an array of non-negative integers nums, you start at the 0th index of the array.

item.title: Leet Code Problems
item.description: Here are my notes on various LeetCode problems Maximum Depth of a Binary Tree Longest Consecutive Subsequence Product of Array Except Self Jumping Game II Decode Ways Container With the Most Water Maximum Area of Island Pacific Atlantic Water Flow Unique Paths Longest Common Subsequence Coin Change II Grid Game Maximum Subsequence Diameter of a Binary Tree House Robber Task Scheduler Reorder List

item.title: Longest Common Subsequence
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given two strings text1 and text2, find the length of the longest common subsequence, where a subsequence of a string is a new string generated from the original string with some number of characters (could be none) deleted and order preserved.

item.title: Longest Consecutive Subsequence
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given an array of numbers, return the length of the longsest consecutive numbers sequence (i.

item.title: Max Area of Island
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem We are given an m x n matrix of 1’s and 0’s, grid, such that the 1’s represent land, and 0’s represent water.

item.title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
item.description: This problem can be found here The Problem Given a binary tree, we need to find the maximum depth of the tree, where the depth of a path is the number of nodes along a path from the root to a leaf node.

item.title: Maximum Subarray
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given an array of integers nums, find the contiguous subarray that has the largest sum, and return the sum.

item.title: Music
item.description: Here lies music that are stuck on repeat! The Electro Suite Funky Wav Bounces Vol.1

item.title: Pacific Atlantic Water Flow
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem We are given an m x n rectangular island that borders both the Pacific and Atlantic Ocean.

item.title: Product of Array Except Self
item.description: This problem can be found here The Problem Given an array of numbers nums, return an array of numbers answer such that answer[i] is equal to the product of all elements in nums except nums[i].

item.title: Reorder List
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem Given a linked list in the following format: $$L_0 \rightarrow L_1 \dots \rightarrow L_{n-1} \rightarrow L_{n}$$

item.title: Research Papers
item.description: Here are research papers that have caught my eye! Assessing Demographic Bias in Named Entity Recognition

item.title: Stochastic Gradient Descent
item.description: What is Gradient Descent? Gradient descent is an iterative first order optimization algorithm that is used to find local minima (or maxima) of functions.

item.title: Task Scheduler
item.description: The problem can be found here The Problem You are given a character array tasks that represent tasks that a CPU needs to perform, where each letter represents a different task.

item.title: The Electro Suite by Hans Zimmer, The Magnificent Six, Pharrell Williams, and Johnny Marr
item.description: This song from The Amazing Spiderman 2 I think is one of the best songs from a movie soundtrack. It is also a very good workout song in my opinion.
